results.title: Behind the switch
results.creator_credit: Shan Benson, State Electricity Commission of Victoria and Neil Howe
results.brief_description: Every switch is a demand for instant electricity. Shows how this demand is met in Victoria. The Latrobe Valley brown coal provides four-fifths of electricity. Shows work at Yallourn and Morwell and progress on the new Hazelwood power station. Use of electricity in industry, at home, for transport, and entertainment. Increasing demands are a measure of the State’s growth and rate of development. Emphasis on ability to meet future demands.

results.title: Behind the skyscrapers
results.creator_credit: Frederick Niemann, National Women's Christian Temperance Union and White Ribbon
results.brief_description: Documentary of life on “Skid Row”, a section of a metropolitan city, where down and out people live in doorways and in condemned housing. Factual, unrehearsed scenes show us their lives.

results.brief_description: A doctor explains to a group of high school girls and boys what tuberculosis is: X-rays and illustrations and animated diagrams are used to assist the doctor in his explanation.

results.title: Behind the seams: designing and manufacturing clothing in Australia
results.creator_credit: Peter Wiseman and Video Education Australasia
results.brief_description: Not an expose on high fashion, but a look at how clothing is made in a modern mass production factory. The programme is intended to erase any pre-conceived ideas about the factory as a dangerous, unpleasant workplace. The viewer is shown the manufacturing process from concept and design, to the finished garment. Divided into two parts entitled, Fashion and design” and “The Factory floor.

results.title: Behind the scenes at Walt Disney studios
results.creator_credit: Walt Disney, Alfred L Werker and Hamilton Luske
results.brief_description: Humorist Robert Benchley visits the Disney Studios to sell Walt on the idea of animating the story of The Reluctant Dragon. While evading an officious young studio guide, Benchley stumbles into various studio activities and departments, including an art class, a sound effects session, the multiplane camera studio (at which point he notices the film has switched to Technicolor), the paint lab, a storyboard session for the “Baby Weems” segment, a movieola screening of the Goofy cartoon “How to Ride a Horse”, and finally catches up with Walt in a screening room just as he’s previewing the studio’s latest film… The Reluctant Dragon! Cinematography by Bert Glennon and Winton C. Hock. Edited by Paul Weatherwax.

results.title: Behind the scenes
results.creator_credit: ACMI Digital Storytelling, Tim Kanoa and ACMI
results.brief_description: Six Indigenous Youth Leadership Programme scholars were invited to participate in a Digital Storytelling workshop at ACMI in June 2007. Here is a glimpse behind the scenes of the workshop and interviews with the participants on their experience.

results.title: Behind the mosquito net = Dibalik kelambu
results.creator_credit: M Sukmajaya, Sukma Putra Film and Teguh Karya
results.brief_description: This film is one of a string of romantic melodramas involving three of the most influential people in the Indonesian film industry. Director Teguh Karya teamed Christine Hakim and Slamet Rahardjo (who were then both members of Teguh’s theatre group, ‘Teater Populer’) as husband and wife, Hasan and Lela. Hasan, unable to meet the expectations of his father-in-law whom the married couple is staying with, is fast losing his self-esteem. Forced to work as a taxi driver after losing his job, he develops an ambiguous relationship with another woman when the situation at home becomes intolerable. Winner of 6 Citra Awards at the 1983 FFI. Music by Eros Djarot, screenwriter Slamet Rahardjo. Cast includes Christine Hakim, Slamet Rahardjo and Nungky Kusumastuti. In Indonesion with English subtitles, which are sometimes difficult to read.

results.title: Behind the menu
results.brief_description: A warning against unsanitary conditions in restaurants, and a demonstration of precautions that should be taken against dirt and harmful bacteria in the handling of food. Suggestions are made for increasing efficiency through better food storage, dishwashing methods and staff facilities. Measures taken by public health authorities to maintain standards in restaurants.
